title: GameLogicPlugin Pulling Incorrect (all zero) ArtifactFromOrigin Pose

content.raw:
When testing on the virtual stix environment the ArtifactOrigin is determined by GameLogicPlugin to be all \{0,0,0,0,0,0\} \(checked this with print statements\) when it should be \{2.0, 4.0, 0.5, 0, 0, 0\} and thus I was unable to score points consistently when factoring in the artifact origin but I was able to score points consistently when factoring in the world origin.

Tested as additional 5.05 and 4.95 distance added to the absolute locations of objects in the virtual stix environment.  I achieved 0/10 correct when trying around the world origin at 5.05 distance and 10/10 correct at 4.95 distance.  The numbers for  around the artifact origin vary due to a random point being generated 5.05 and 4.95 distance away every time but essentially they’re both non-zero and non-10 meaning.

When testing on the virtual stix environment the ArtifactOrigin is determined by GameLogicPlugin to be all {0,0,0,0,0,0} (checked this with print statements) when it should be {2.0, 4.0, 0.5, 0, 0, 0} and thus I was unable to score points consistently when factoring in the artifact origin but I was able to score points consistently when factoring in the world origin.

Tested as additional 5.05 and 4.95 distance added to the absolute locations of objects in the virtual stix environment. I achieved 0/10 correct when trying around the world origin at 5.05 distance and 10/10 correct at 4.95 distance. The numbers for around the artifact origin vary due to a random point being generated 5.05 and 4.95 distance away every time but essentially they’re both non-zero and non-10 meaning.
